intro: Alibertia melloana, commonly known as Melloana's alibertia, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and typically have five petals. Alibertia melloana is often found in moist, shaded environments within the dense understory of tropical forests.
